com.iciql

Class Db

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iciql.Db

  • public class Db
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a connection to a database.

        public static void registerDialect(java.lang.String token,
                   java.lang.Class<? extends SQLDialect> dialectClass)
        Register a new/custom dialect class. You can use this method to replace any existing dialect or to add a new one.
        Parameters:
        token - the fully qualified name of the connection class or the expected result of DatabaseMetaData.getDatabaseProductName()
        dialectClass - the dialect class to register

      • merge

        public <T> void merge(T t)
        Merge INSERTS if the record does not exist or UPDATES the record if it does exist. Not all databases support MERGE and the syntax varies with the database. If the database does not support a MERGE syntax the dialect can try to simulate a merge by implementing:

        INSERT INTO foo... (SELECT ?,... FROM foo WHERE pk=? HAVING count(*)=0)

        iciql will check the affected row count returned by the internal merge method and if the affected row count = 0, it will issue an update.

        See the Derby dialect for an implementation of this technique.

        If the dialect does not support merge an IciqlException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        t -

         JdbcUtils.closeSilently(rs, true);
        Parameters:
        sql - the SQL statement
        args - optional object arguments for x=? tokens in query
        Returns:
        the result set

      • setSkipCreate

        public void setSkipCreate(boolean skipCreate)
        Allow to enable/disable globally createIfRequired in TableDefinition. For advanced user wanting to gain full control of transactions. Default value is false.
        Parameters:
        skipCreate -
